subject: Re: [junit] question about the use of a framework change  between 3.7 and 3.8
msgSnippet: So said  agroebbe  on  12/5/2002 -------------------- ... The best practice is *always* to use what you need and not to use what you don t need. ... Frankly, I
messageBody:
So said agroebbe on 12/5/2002 --------------------

>Hi,
>
>following change was introduced
>(making that 3.8 tests sometimes don't compile in 3.7) :
>
>Made the string argument TestCase constructor optional. You can now
>delete constructors of the form
>"FooTestCase(String name) {
> super(name);
> }".
>
>What is the best practice now : still using the String argument
>constructor ?

The best practice is *always* to use what you need and not to use what
you don't need.

>Why should you not use the old STring argument constructor ?

Frankly, I don't know; but I imagine it's there for something. I
believe it's just a shortcut for "new TestCase(), setName(String)".

J. B. Rainsberger,
